speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Well met, Corporal Nym.

speaker: NYM
text: Good morrow, Lieutenant Bardolph.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: What, are Ancient Pistol and you friends

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: yet?

speaker: NYM
text: For my part, I care not. I say little, but when time

speaker: NYM
text: shall serve, there shall be smiles; but that shall be as

speaker: NYM
text: it may. I dare not fight, but I will wink and hold out

speaker: NYM
text: mine iron. It is a simple one, but what though? It

speaker: NYM
text: will toast cheese, and it will endure cold as another

speaker: NYM
text: man’s sword will, and there’s an end.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: I will bestow a breakfast to make you

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: friends, and we’ll be all three sworn brothers to

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: France. Let ’t be so, good Corporal Nym.

speaker: NYM
text: Faith, I will live so long as I may, that’s the

speaker: NYM
text: certain of it; and when I cannot live any longer, I

speaker: NYM
text: will do as I may. That is my rest, that is the

speaker: NYM
text: rendezvous of it.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: It is certain, corporal, that he is married to

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Nell Quickly, and certainly she did you wrong, for

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: you were troth-plight to her.

speaker: NYM
text: I cannot tell. Things must be as they may. Men

speaker: NYM
text: may sleep, and they may have their throats about

speaker: NYM
text: them at that time, and some say knives have edges.

speaker: NYM
text: It must be as it may. Though patience be a tired

speaker: NYM
text: mare, yet she will plod. There must be conclusions.

speaker: NYM
text: Well, I cannot tell.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Here comes Ancient Pistol and his wife.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Good corporal, be patient here.—How now, mine

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: host Pistol?

speaker: PISTOL
text: Base tyke, call’st thou me host? Now, by this

speaker: PISTOL
text: hand, I swear I scorn the term, nor shall my Nell

speaker: PISTOL
text: keep lodgers.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: No, by my troth, not long; for we cannot

speaker: HOSTESS
text: lodge and board a dozen or fourteen gentlewomen

speaker: HOSTESS
text: that live honestly by the prick of their needles but it

speaker: HOSTESS
text: will be thought we keep a bawdy house straight.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O well-a-day, Lady! If he be not hewn now, we shall

speaker: HOSTESS
text: see willful adultery and murder committed.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Good lieutenant, good corporal, offer nothing

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: here.

speaker: NYM
text: Pish!

speaker: PISTOL
text: Pish for thee, Iceland dog, thou prick-eared

speaker: PISTOL
text: cur of Iceland!

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Good Corporal Nym, show thy valor, and put

speaker: HOSTESS
text: up your sword.

speaker: NYM
text:
Will you shog off?
                 
                To
                 
                Pistol
                .
               I would have you

speaker: NYM
text: solus.

speaker: PISTOL
text: “Solus,” egregious dog? O viper vile, the solus

speaker: PISTOL
text: in thy most marvelous face, the solus in thy teeth

speaker: PISTOL
text: and in thy throat and in thy hateful lungs, yea, in thy

speaker: PISTOL
text: maw, perdy, and, which is worse, within thy nasty

speaker: PISTOL
text: mouth! I do retort the solus in thy bowels, for I can

speaker: PISTOL
text: take, and Pistol’s cock is up, and flashing fire will

speaker: PISTOL
text: follow.

speaker: NYM
text: I am not Barbason, you cannot conjure me. I

speaker: NYM
text: have an humor to knock you indifferently well. If

speaker: NYM
text: you grow foul with me, Pistol, I will scour you with

speaker: NYM
text: my rapier, as I may, in fair terms. If you would walk

speaker: NYM
text: off, I would prick your guts a little in good terms, as

speaker: NYM
text: I may, and that’s the humor of it.

speaker: PISTOL
text:
O
               
              braggart
               
              vile
               
              and
               
              damnèd
               
              furious
               
              wight
              ,

speaker: PISTOL
text:
The
               
              grave
               
              doth
               
              gape
              ,
               
              and
               
              doting
               
              death
               
              is
               
              near
              .

speaker: PISTOL
text:
Therefore
               
              exhale
              .

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Hear me, hear me what I say: he that strikes

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: the first stroke, I’ll run him up to the hilts, as I am a

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: soldier.

speaker: PISTOL
text: An oath of mickle might, and fury shall abate.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Give me thy fist, thy forefoot to me give. Thy spirits

speaker: PISTOL
text: are most tall.

speaker: NYM
text: I will cut thy throat one time or other

speaker: NYM
text: in fair terms, that is the humor of it.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Couple à gorge, that is the word. I defy thee

speaker: PISTOL
text: again. O hound of Crete, think’st thou my spouse to

speaker: PISTOL
text: get? No, to the spital go, and from the powd’ring tub

speaker: PISTOL
text: of infamy fetch forth the lazar kite of Cressid’s kind,

speaker: PISTOL
text: Doll Tearsheet she by name, and her espouse. I

speaker: PISTOL
text: have, and I will hold, the quondam Quickly for the

speaker: PISTOL
text: only she: and pauca, there’s enough too! Go to.

speaker: BOY
text: Mine host Pistol, you must come to my master,

speaker: BOY
text: and your hostess. He is very sick and would to

speaker: BOY
text: bed.—Good Bardolph, put thy face between his

speaker: BOY
text: sheets, and do the office of a warming-pan. Faith,

speaker: BOY
text: he’s very ill.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Away, you rogue!

speaker: HOSTESS
text: By my troth, he’ll yield the crow a pudding

speaker: HOSTESS
text: one of these days. The King has killed his heart.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Good husband, come home presently.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Come, shall I make you two friends? We

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: must to France together. Why the devil should we

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: keep knives to cut one another’s throats?

speaker: PISTOL
text:
Let
               
              floods
               
              o’erswell
               
              and
               
              fiends
               
              for
               
              food
               
              howl
               
              on
              !

speaker: NYM
text: You’ll pay me the eight shillings I won of you at

speaker: NYM
text: betting?

speaker: PISTOL
text: Base is the slave that pays.

speaker: NYM
text: That now I will have, that’s the humor of it.

speaker: PISTOL
text: As manhood shall compound. Push home.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: By this sword, he that

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: makes the first thrust, I’ll kill him. By this sword, I

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: will.

speaker: PISTOL
text: “Sword” is an oath, and

speaker: PISTOL
text: oaths must have their course.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Corporal Nym, an thou wilt be friends, be

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: friends; an thou wilt not, why then be enemies with

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: me too. Prithee, put up.

speaker: PISTOL
text: A noble shalt thou have, and present

speaker: PISTOL
text: pay, and liquor likewise will I give to thee, and

speaker: PISTOL
text: friendship shall combine, and brotherhood. I’ll live

speaker: PISTOL
text: by Nym, and Nym shall live by me. Is not this just?

speaker: PISTOL
text: For I shall sutler be unto the camp, and profits will

speaker: PISTOL
text: accrue. Give me thy hand.

speaker: NYM
text: I shall have my noble?

speaker: PISTOL
text: In cash, most justly paid.

speaker: NYM
text: Well, then, that’s the humor of ’t.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: As ever you come of women, come in quickly

speaker: HOSTESS
text: to Sir John. Ah, poor heart, he is so shaked of a

speaker: HOSTESS
text: burning quotidian-tertian that it is most lamentable

speaker: HOSTESS
text: to behold. Sweet men, come to him.

speaker: NYM
text: The King hath run bad humors on the knight,

speaker: NYM
text: that’s the even of it.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Nym, thou hast spoke the right. His heart is

speaker: PISTOL
text: fracted and corroborate.

speaker: NYM
text: The King is a good king, but it must be as it may;

speaker: NYM
text: he passes some humors and careers.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Let us condole the knight, for, lambkins, we

speaker: PISTOL
text: will live.
